availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Tennessee in 1818. Married Mary F. Mott on November 10, 1841 in Scott County, Missouri. Employed as a Physician in Fulton County, Kentucky in 1860. During the Civil War he served as a Surgeon in Cheatham's Division of the Confederate Army. Was Captured by Union forces after the Battle of Perryville. Relocated to prison hospital and later military hospital in Knoxville, Tennessee. Died on October 18, 1878 in Fulton County, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Don Livingston, "Dr. John Marshall Alexander," Find A Grave, Published January 29, 2012, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=84153395&ref=acom; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 40; United States. The War of the Rebellion: A Compilation of the Official Records of the Union and Confederate Armies Series II, Vol. 5 (Washington: G.P.O., 1880) 16.
